cot.content:
To solve the problem, Please think and reason step by step, then answer.
question:
Which group recorded the albums called 'Raintown', 'Fellow Hoodlums' and 'Homesick'?
        
Generation Format:
Reasoning process:
Answer:

Reasoning process:
To determine which group recorded the albums 'Raintown', 'Fellow Hoodlums', and 'Homesick', I will first identify the albums and their respective artists. 

1. 'Raintown' is the debut album released in 1987.
2. 'Fellow Hoodlums' is the second album released in 1990.
3. 'Homesick' is the third album released in 1992.

After researching these albums, I find that they were all recorded by the Scottish band Deacon Blue. 

Answer:
Deacon Blue

anchoring.content:
You are a cognitive scientist, to answer the following question:
Which group recorded the albums called 'Raintown', 'Fellow Hoodlums' and 'Homesick'?
I will provide you with several retrieved passages:
Passages:
['Rappin\' Down Town is the third album from New York City-based rap/hip hop group The Sugarhill Gang. Released in 1983, this album includes the minor R&B hits "The Lover in You" and "The Word is Out."\n', '"Truckdrivin Neighbors Downstairs (Yellow Sweat)" is a song by the American musician Beck. It was released on his 1994 album "Mellow Gold". The song was composed in the key of A-flat major.\n', 'Fellow Hoodlums is the third studio album by the Scottish rock band Deacon Blue, released in 1991. It includes four singles; "Your Swaying Arms", the Top 10 hit "Twist and Shout", "Closing Time" and "Cover from the Sky".\n', 'BULLET::::- "Torchin\' Towns, Hankerin\' Homes" (August 1996)\xa0– Lonely Guy Records\n', 'Raintown is the debut album by Scottish pop band Deacon Blue. The album, written largely by lead singer Ricky Ross, was released in the United Kingdom on 1 May 1987. It proved a commercial success and has to date sold around a million copies, peaking in the UK Albums Chart at no. 14 and remaining in the charts for a year and a half.\n', 'The Rangehoods were an American Rock band formed in Seattle, Washington in 1984. The group released one EP titled "Rought Town" in 1985 under Big D Records, and released it on cassette in 1985 under Exploding records. In 1991 they released their only studio album, "Long Way Home" under the same record company. The band started out under the name The Pins, but renamed to The Rangehoods after guitarist and lead singer Steve Pearson joined (formerly being<--to avoid false positives in search for \'being led/lead\' typo--> lead singer of The Heats).\n', 'Homesick Heroes is a studio album by The Charlie Daniels Band released on August 15, 1988. The album is known for the CDB\'s cover of the Jimmy Dean classic, "Big Bad John," which also includes guest vocals by The Oak Ridge Boys.\n', 'Home is the debut studio album by British drum and bass band Rudimental. It was released on 29 April 2013 by Asylum Records, Atlantic Records and Black Butter Records. The album includes the singles "Spoons", "Feel the Love", "Not Giving In", "Waiting All Night", "Right Here", and "Free", "Powerless", and "Give You Up". The album cover features the Hackney Peace Carnival Mural. It was nominated for the 2013 Mercury Prize.\n', '"Downtown" is the third single from electropop band Kids of 88 off their debut album "Sugarpills". This song was released digitally through the New Zealand iTunes Store on 19 July 2010.\n', "Hopetown is a 2000 album by New Zealand singer-songwriter Dave Dobbyn. It reached number 9 on the New Zealand music charts. The album was produced by fellow Th' Dudes member Ian Morris.\n"]

cognition.content:
Fact-checking refers to the process of confirming the accuracy of a statement or claim through various sources or methods. 
This process aims to ensure that statements or claims are based on reliable and verifiable information while eliminating inaccurate or misleading content. 
Fact-checking may involve the examination of data, literature, expert opinions, or other trustworthy sources.
In the context of artificial intelligence, model illusion refers to the overconfidence response of the AI. 
When a model exhibits an 'illusion' (a tendency to output deceptive data), it indicates that the training data used by the model does not necessarily support the rationality of its outputs.
You are a scientist researching fact-checking and addressing model illusions in artificial intelligence. 
To answer the following question:
Which group recorded the albums called 'Raintown', 'Fellow Hoodlums' and 'Homesick'?
I will provide you with several retrieved passages:
Passages:
['Rappin\' Down Town is the third album from New York City-based rap/hip hop group The Sugarhill Gang. Released in 1983, this album includes the minor R&B hits "The Lover in You" and "The Word is Out."\n', '"Truckdrivin Neighbors Downstairs (Yellow Sweat)" is a song by the American musician Beck. It was released on his 1994 album "Mellow Gold". The song was composed in the key of A-flat major.\n', 'Fellow Hoodlums is the third studio album by the Scottish rock band Deacon Blue, released in 1991. It includes four singles; "Your Swaying Arms", the Top 10 hit "Twist and Shout", "Closing Time" and "Cover from the Sky".\n', 'BULLET::::- "Torchin\' Towns, Hankerin\' Homes" (August 1996)\xa0– Lonely Guy Records\n', 'Raintown is the debut album by Scottish pop band Deacon Blue. The album, written largely by lead singer Ricky Ross, was released in the United Kingdom on 1 May 1987. It proved a commercial success and has to date sold around a million copies, peaking in the UK Albums Chart at no. 14 and remaining in the charts for a year and a half.\n', 'The Rangehoods were an American Rock band formed in Seattle, Washington in 1984. The group released one EP titled "Rought Town" in 1985 under Big D Records, and released it on cassette in 1985 under Exploding records. In 1991 they released their only studio album, "Long Way Home" under the same record company. The band started out under the name The Pins, but renamed to The Rangehoods after guitarist and lead singer Steve Pearson joined (formerly being<--to avoid false positives in search for \'being led/lead\' typo--> lead singer of The Heats).\n', 'Homesick Heroes is a studio album by The Charlie Daniels Band released on August 15, 1988. The album is known for the CDB\'s cover of the Jimmy Dean classic, "Big Bad John," which also includes guest vocals by The Oak Ridge Boys.\n', 'Home is the debut studio album by British drum and bass band Rudimental. It was released on 29 April 2013 by Asylum Records, Atlantic Records and Black Butter Records. The album includes the singles "Spoons", "Feel the Love", "Not Giving In", "Waiting All Night", "Right Here", and "Free", "Powerless", and "Give You Up". The album cover features the Hackney Peace Carnival Mural. It was nominated for the 2013 Mercury Prize.\n', '"Downtown" is the third single from electropop band Kids of 88 off their debut album "Sugarpills". This song was released digitally through the New Zealand iTunes Store on 19 July 2010.\n', "Hopetown is a 2000 album by New Zealand singer-songwriter Dave Dobbyn. It reached number 9 on the New Zealand music charts. The album was produced by fellow Th' Dudes member Ian Morris.\n"]

question_info.question: Which group recorded the albums called 'Raintown', 'Fellow Hoodlums' and 'Homesick'?
passages:
Rappin' Down Town is the third album from New York City-based rap/hip hop group The Sugarhill Gang. Released in 1983, this album includes the minor R&B hits "The Lover in You" and "The Word is Out."
"Truckdrivin Neighbors Downstairs (Yellow Sweat)" is a song by the American musician Beck. It was released on his 1994 album "Mellow Gold". The song was composed in the key of A-flat major.
Fellow Hoodlums is the third studio album by the Scottish rock band Deacon Blue, released in 1991. It includes four singles; "Your Swaying Arms", the Top 10 hit "Twist and Shout", "Closing Time" and "Cover from the Sky".
BULLET::::- "Torchin' Towns, Hankerin' Homes" (August 1996) – Lonely Guy Records
Raintown is the debut album by Scottish pop band Deacon Blue. The album, written largely by lead singer Ricky Ross, was released in the United Kingdom on 1 May 1987. It proved a commercial success and has to date sold around a million copies, peaking in the UK Albums Chart at no. 14 and remaining in the charts for a year and a half.
The Rangehoods were an American Rock band formed in Seattle, Washington in 1984. The group released one EP titled "Rought Town" in 1985 under Big D Records, and released it on cassette in 1985 under Exploding records. In 1991 they released their only studio album, "Long Way Home" under the same record company. The band started out under the name The Pins, but renamed to The Rangehoods after guitarist and lead singer Steve Pearson joined (formerly being<--to avoid false positives in search for 'being led/lead' typo--> lead singer of The Heats).
Homesick Heroes is a studio album by The Charlie Daniels Band released on August 15, 1988. The album is known for the CDB's cover of the Jimmy Dean classic, "Big Bad John," which also includes guest vocals by The Oak Ridge Boys.
Home is the debut studio album by British drum and bass band Rudimental. It was released on 29 April 2013 by Asylum Records, Atlantic Records and Black Butter Records. The album includes the singles "Spoons", "Feel the Love", "Not Giving In", "Waiting All Night", "Right Here", and "Free", "Powerless", and "Give You Up". The album cover features the Hackney Peace Carnival Mural. It was nominated for the 2013 Mercury Prize.
"Downtown" is the third single from electropop band Kids of 88 off their debut album "Sugarpills". This song was released digitally through the New Zealand iTunes Store on 19 July 2010.
Hopetown is a 2000 album by New Zealand singer-songwriter Dave Dobbyn. It reached number 9 on the New Zealand music charts. The album was produced by fellow Th' Dudes member Ian Morris.
